Reviews.Title: “Good location, but ........!!!”
Reviews.Author: vrahneika
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very noisy area, something that makes sleeping not so convenient but is very appreciable if you want to see the city!! The hotel has two styles of rooms (old and new). From our group we were the lucky since we had a good room, but our friends had the bad one. Almost everybody found a towel with a hole, but thank God clean!! Then we had to face the phone device problem , since our phone was out of order and we couldn't call or receive calls!!! Finally i called just once from the reception since nobody was coming to repair our phone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, it is 3* rather than 4*”
Reviews.Author: SofiaGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends visited Hotel Santa Pera for 4 nights, we booked 3 triple rooms, The Hotel staff was very helpful, they even helped to organize a transfer. The Hotel is well located, 200 m to Istiklal Street, full of shops and cafes. The hotel rooms were small, and the bathrooms were too old, but clean, The breakfast was good. But I think that this hotel is 3* rather than 4*, although I would recommend it to "budget travelers", students and people who prefer location to comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Like a horror movie!”
Reviews.Author: ma8el
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in January - 2012. They were repairing the hotel so this means we couldn't get rest for a short while because of the noise from outside and at the same time inside! Secondly, the bathrooms were awful! Very dirty, old and cold.. I dont know how to explain it but just imagine the worst bathroom you have ever seen. In our first room which is located on the 2. floor, we couldnt take a shower because of scum and cold. I also want to be fair about staff. They tried to help us after hearing our complaints but the problem was that: if we could change room after telling them - so this means they had some other better rooms- why did they give us the worst room in the first step??? I found this behaviour a bit tricky! Breakfasts were all right but not spectacular. So , to sum up, I don't recommend this hotel to anyone . You can easily find nicer hotels in Taksim with the same price. (about 50 Euros for a night.) As a Turkish I also feel shame at the hotel and feel sorry about our reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every dollar you pay There”
Reviews.Author: Avraham21
Reviews.Content: My experience in Istanbul need to know which hotels have to not be disappointed, at the Santa Pera You sure will not be disappointed from the service and nice people, there is value for your money in Santa Pera hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't come to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sh_salama85
Reviews.Content: Didn't like it at all, No way this is 4-star, it is 1-2 star,the service is so bad,The lights in the room are terrible. There is no slipper, no glass.the stuff not good,very rude and very bad facilities

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Think of Statying There!”
Reviews.Author: AG4E
Reviews.Content: There is nothing good to say about this hotel. The location was the worst neighborhood I had ever seen in all my trips: There were brothels everywhere in the neighborhood!!! There was a very long walk to any place for shopping and even to the nearest payphone (I was told it was near Taksim). A lot of traffic noise at night (The hotel is located off a very busy street!!!). We (my wife and I) stayed there for a night and couldnâ€™t take it for another night (our reservation was for 4 nights). The night shift receptionist was very rude. The room, hotel restaurant, and corridors were damp. The bathroom was so filthy that we didnâ€™t dare take a shower there. The breakfast was awful. Almost no one speaks any language other than Turkish. The bed was very uncomfortable and gave me a backache. The TV in the room was an antique 14-inch! Just avoid the hotel â€“ actually I wouldnâ€™t call it a hotel let alone a 4-star one.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagyHanna
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel and the staff is very very helpful escpecially Mr Ismail Cice ,the front office manager , he is very helpful we used to ask him about every place we want to go .The room ia a little bit narrow but alwaysssssssssssss clean ,the house keeping staff are always there for your comfort .The breakfast is very good ,a variety of food.Finally thnx to santa pera hotel

Reviews.Title: “its 2 star not 4,the stuff not good,very bad facilites”
Reviews.Author: Hussein81
Reviews.Content: we arrive istanbul on 22march 2010,hotel is far away from taksim square,the reception not helpful even when we advise him that we r honey mooner,just try to sell to us tripsarround istanbul,the breakfast very poor,the room very noisy,narrow,the bath room was so dirty ,the hotel rate so expensive 120$ per dbl room ,our reservation was for 5nts,when we check out after 2nts stay ,the receiptionest called ismail treatment us with nervous way ,i recommend elit world istanbul ,we stay very nice 3 nts there ,was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Pay more and get a good hotel, avoid this one.”
Reviews.Author: jaye321
Reviews.Content: This hotel smells of sewage. It overlooks an 8 lane motorway which is very noisy 24h and difficult to sleep. The staff and not very friendly and only speak very basic English. The breakfast is not western/ continental; its Turkish; olives, potatoes, raisins, soup. The TV only shows Turkish channels. You may see on the hotel website that there is a free transfer service, well when I tried to book this they hung up the phone on me. The receptionist said they have no such service and no website. I advise travellers to pay more money and get a known chain like best western or it may ruin your vacation. All the hotels of this grade around Taxim are pretty much the same.This is not a European/ US 4 star hotel, please bear that in mind. This is more like a 2 star. If you want a budget hotel and you can put up with all that stuff then go right ahead and book.

Reviews.Title: “KEEP AWAY”
Reviews.Author: KOOLZ
Reviews.Content: I have nothing good to say about this hotel. The location was a tragedy â€“ the worst neighborhood I have seen in all the trips I have taken: There were at least 5 brothels in the neighborhood!!! and homeless people were everywhere; there was a very long walk to any place for shopping (Taksim for instance) and even to the nearest payphone. And the traffic noise was a killer at night (The hotel is located on a highway!!!). We (my wife and I) stayed there for two nights and after the second night I couldnâ€™t take it anymore. The night shift receptionist was rude with his inappropriate jokes and gestures (I canâ€™t say what he actually did!!!); the entire hotel, including our room, was damp and the bathroom ceiling was actually collapsing (see the pictures); their room service is a joke: one time I asked for hot water and someone came at the door with a glass of hot water in his hand â€“ donâ€™t they have teapots there?! The breakfast is way below average; the staff, except for the receptionists, barely speaks any language other than Turkish; the bed gave me the worst backache of my life; the TV is an antique 14-inch! The bathroom was so filthy that neither of us dared to take a shower there during the two nights. Just avoid the hotel â€“ actually I wouldnâ€™t call it a hotel let alone a 4-star one. On the second day I moved to The Plaza which is way better for only US$50 extra per night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pay more and go to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: gsijim
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two days and it wasn't a very pleasant experience.Although we had a reservation the room wasn't ready when we arrived.When we went to bed we realized there were no blankets!!Not at all!!I talked with the reception and they informed me that that all the blankets were wet from the previous night rain!!!!But at least they gave us two piquet.The breakfast was as simple as it gets.Not recommended at all!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “For 3* prizes 4* quality”
Reviews.Author: wildrat
Reviews.Content: A very friendly hotel, without any problem they look for solutions, about hotel, new fohn directly given, speaking good english, able to fix problem with wifi, works good, double glass, view on Santa Palace(Orient Express) nearly renovated. also over the Ataturkbridge you see skyline minarets from Topkapi to Eyup. If you don;t go to Beyoglu Istikla Cadesi 5 minuts walking, you can take a taxi from the big Pera taxi-stand and busses in al directions. If you like also to take a dolmustaxi over the Bosporus just walk the road down. 24hours roomservice, airco, and very good cleaning, used towels refreshed daily, bathroom, bed, room everything cleaned everyday

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Respente
Reviews.Content: The good things of this hotel are the cleanliness the service the location and the price. The only bad thing was that the water of the shower wasn't warm enough. Anyway I would go again to this hotel, and I reccomend to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Just dont go there...”
Reviews.Author: PlayboyNorthampton
Reviews.Content: Very poor. Water leaking through ceiling. Some lights work sometimes. Food ok but no more. Cross the road outside with extreme care, if you dare. It is at least close to a good shopping and eating strret, with a vintage tram. There are better places to stay in this superb city.

Reviews.Title: “the worst place you can stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hedayet
Reviews.Content: they are not recommed to be 4 stars Hotel at all this hotel sould not be more than 2 stars .

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: gerdag
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not that bad. the stuff helps only if the person speaks english which didnt always happend and they usualy recomend onplaces which they work with, and its preety hard to receive honest information. they will tell u to go to a super expensive hamam or belly ancers show and would not tell u that there r cheeper things around even though its obvious that its a lot to pay 50 eurous for hamam. the room is nice and cousy, clean. the breakfast is nice includes a lot of food and the location is preety close to istiklal but there is no tram near the hotel just buses. the walk from the hotel is not that fun, its quite poor area but the nview changes fast as u get closer to galata tower and the istiklal cadessi. there r two sides for the hotel rooms- quiter side with sapousedy smaller rooms and the loud side which has a view on a highway. its not that noisy if the windows are closed and there is a rteal problem only on saturday night when the traffic is terrible at n ight and then its gets quite noisy. i was there with my boyfriend and i thinks its not too bad for a couple on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Worst thing in our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Basbousa2008
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the worst part of our holiday. We hated coming back to it every night. The rooms are very small, the bathroom is miserable. No two people can stand in it together. It's very noisy as it's on a very busy street but they could've invested in sound proof glass! Our room smelled like smoke all the time as there aren't enough non-smoking rooms in the hotel. The housekeeping wasn't efficient at all and we had to ask for soap, shampoo, shower gel etc. in addition to having our towels changed. That's needless to say that the bed sheets haven't been changed during our 6 day stay at the hotel. The television was very small, we had to strain our eyes to watch it. In addition that there was only 1 English speaking chanel! The breakfast was very very poor with only a small variety of jam, boiled eggs, two kinds of cheese and black and green olives. The staff was ok on the whole, except for a couple of nervous, never friendly people. In summary, we would never go there again. Turkey is a great place and we really loved visiting it and really considering going there again but definitely not to this hotel. I could hardly believe that it is a 4 star hotel, looked more like a 1 star inn to me.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky, noisy, friendly”
Reviews.Author: sng8888
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay on the modern side of Istanbul for a few days before heading to the historic district. Hotels on this side are more expensive as they were business oriented. We choose this hotel because it was close to the local night life district of Beyoglu and near the major shopping street of Istiklal Avenue. The area is modern Turkey local in flavour and not very touristy which was what we were looking. Our hotel was a 5 minute walk away from this action across a major road which we had chosen because we were afraid of late night noise from revelers. The first thing we noticed was our room was very smoky. We were told that there was only 1 non smoking room per floor and they were full. Since it was our first night in Turkey, and noticing the much greater prevalence of smoking, we assumed this would be the norm. On our later travels in Turkey in similar quality hotels, we didn't find this problem. The hotel is newish like the photos on the website. It's location is ideal for Istiklal avenue although you have to cross a very busy road but there is a pedestrian intersection. Unfortunately traffic noise is loud as it's by this busy road. Access to the old town is easy as buses run down this road towards the old town. Breakfast was adequate. Typical Turkish choices with some cheese, breads and local cold cuts. Free Wifi is available but partially because the building is concrete, and secondly cause it's 7 stories tall, reception is good only on the first few floors. I surfed with my laptop in the lobby. Staff was helpful and friendly. Cleaning done was adequate. Rooms were mainly new except we noticed peeling paint on the ceilings. Floors looked like new hardwood veneer. In all it was adequate accommodation for the upgraded backpacking style of travel we were doing, except for the really smoky rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: Santa Pera Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: TepebasI Refik Saydam Cad. No: 312 | Beyoglu, Istanbul, Turkey
